ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: I think in general the opportunity to learn English from native speakers is great, because we are Ph.D. students and so our friends are busy to teach us the pronunciation and vocabulary. Also, they would think language is of second order importance compared to the research. But indeed this is of first order importance for us. So this class offered a great opportunity, and this is the strength. The weakness is that this class does not offer the credit. This might have reduced students' engagement.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: This depends on what workload you have in the semester. This class definitely offers you important insights about English communication, but this also takes time and potentially makes you stressed. Also, this is not a required course, so if you do not commit to engage, you will end up losing your precious time without learning a lot.
